content: Hey, I’m Riya. I just moved to Bangalore a year ago and I’m still figuring out my routine.
I work as a product manager at a fintech startup and honestly the context switching fries my brain most days.
I’m very much a night owl – my brain only starts working properly after 9pm, even though I keep trying to become a morning person.
I’ve been feeling pretty burnt out lately, like I’m constantly behind on something.
Also, I’m an only child, so I tend to overthink my parents’ expectations a lot.
I absolutely love strong masala chai, but coffee makes me super jittery and anxious.
I’m vegetarian, but I’m not super strict if there’s egg in desserts or baked stuff.
I get overwhelmed in big social gatherings – I prefer 1:1 conversations or very small groups.
Mondays are the worst for me emotionally; I usually wake up with this heavy anxious feeling in my chest.
Music helps a lot – I usually listen to lo-fi or soft Bollywood while working to calm myself down.
In my free time I love story-driven video games and cozy indie games, nothing too competitive.
I’m trying to build a consistent workout habit, but right now it’s like… two walks a week at best.
I prefer texting over calls; unexpected phone calls spike my anxiety immediately.
I mainly use WhatsApp and Notion to organize my life – if it’s not in Notion, I will 100% forget it.
I’m on Android right now, but I keep flirting with the idea of switching to an iPhone just for the camera.
I tend to bottle up my feelings until I suddenly have a mini meltdown over something small, like a delayed message.
I’m in a long-distance relationship and I get very insecure when replies are slow, even though I logically know they’re busy.
I’ve noticed I’m harsh on myself when I make even tiny mistakes at work, like a typo in a spec.
Sleep is messy – some nights I scroll till 2am because my brain doesn’t want to shut up.
When I’m really stressed, I either overeat junk food or skip meals entirely, there’s no in-between.
One big goal this year is to switch into a more ML/AI-focused role, but I’m scared I’m not smart enough.
I value honesty a lot; if someone lies to me even once, I find it hard to trust them again.
My comfort show is ‘Friends’ – I rewatch random episodes when I feel lonely or overloaded.
I’m very sensitive to tone in messages; even a short ‘k’ can send me into overthinking mode.
I really want to build a stable routine with exercise, deep work blocks, and proper sleep, but I keep slipping back.
Work calls late in the evening really drain me; I prefer meetings before 5pm if possible.
I feel safest when someone explains things step by step instead of just telling me to ‘figure it out’.
If I sound sarcastic, I’m usually masking that I’m anxious or embarrassed, not actually angry.
I love when people remember small details about me, like my chai preference or that I hate loud bars.
If I disappear for a bit, it’s usually because I’m overwhelmed, not because I don’t want to talk – I just need gentle check-ins, not pressure.
